"Kevin [pitched]...taking all...OGs off the board," he said, adding he and Anthony Russo felt Kevin's pitch was "way too aggressive". Robert Downey Jr's Iron Man and Scarlett Johansson's Black Widow were killed in the movie.

351.title: Proud that Indian flag soared because of me: Priyanka on CWG race walk silver
351.article_body: Priyanka Goswami, who became the first-ever Indian woman to win a silver medal in 10,000 metres race walk at CWG, said she's very proud that the Indian flag soared because of her. "I'm elated," she added. The 26-year-old clocked 43:38.83, her personal best, to win silver on Saturday. Overall, this is India's second medal in race walk at CWG.

352.title: UN chief attends 77th anniversary of atomic bombing in Japan
352.article_body: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres joined Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida at the Hiroshima Peace Park on Saturday to remember the world's first atomic bombing 77 years ago. "Nuclear weapons are nonsense. They guarantee...only death and destruction," Guterres said. US on August 6, 1945, dropped the world's first atomic bomb on Japan, killing 1,40,000 people.

353.title: Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat wins her 3rd gold medal in CWG history
353.article_body: India's 27-year-old wrestler Vinesh Phogat bagged gold medal in the women's freestyle 53 kg category at CWG 2022. Phogat won the gold after winning each of her three matches in the Nordic System group. She beat Canada's Samantha Stewart, Nigeria's Mercy Bolafunoluwa Adekuoroye and Sri Lanka's Chamodya Keshani Maduravalage Don. Vinesh has now won three gold medals in CWG history.

354.title: Ex-Union Minister RCP Singh quits JD(U) amid corruption allegations by party
354.article_body: Hours after Janata Dal (United) reportedly sought an explanation from party leader RCP Singh over corruption allegations against him, the former Union Minister quit the Nitish Kumar-led party. "The allegations are a conspiracy by those who envied my getting inducted into the Union cabinet...Those living in glass houses must not hurl stones at others," Singh said at a press conference.

355.title: I don't hate Vivian; if I dislike someone, why would I've baby with them: Neena
355.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said in an interview that even though she has moved on from her previous relationships, she has never hated her exes. "I believe once you love somebody, how can you hate?" she added. Referring to former West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, Neena said, "If I dislike someone, why would I've a baby with them? Am I mad?"

356.title: Naxalites kill man suspecting him to be a police informer in MP
356.article_body: Naxalites have murdered a man in MP's Balaghat district following suspicion that he was a police informer, an official said on Saturday. The deceased, Lalu Dhurve, was in his late 20s, police said, adding such acts are intended to create fear among the locals. Police said the Naxalites left behind pamphlets, claiming Dhurve was a police informer.

357.title: It's 74%; Let it sink in: BL Santhosh on Dhankar's win in VP polls
357.article_body: BJP's National General Secretary (Organisation) BL Santhosh has commented on the NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar's win in the Vice-President polls. "Dhankhar wins VP elections by securing 528 of the 725 votes," Santhosh said. He added, "It's 74%. Let it sink in. From [a] farm background, distinguished legal luminary will add further value [to] the luminaries who occupied that chair."

358.title: Assam reports 3 deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis, 12 new cases
358.article_body: Three deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis were recorded in Assam on Saturday, as per a release issued by the National Health Mission. According to the release, the state also reported 12 new cases of the infection during the day. Saturday's cases took Assam's tally of Japanese Encephalitis cases reported since the beginning of July to 347.

359.title: The man is also going to have a child: Alia on her reaction to post about her pregnancy
359.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who had criticised a report claiming her pregnancy might delay her Hollywood career, said, "You're not saying that about the man, the man is also going to have the child...Why is it only for the woman?" "You are making a commentary on a woman in general, who is actually working since the beginning of (her) pregnancy," she added.

360.title: Maybe it's not my time, maybe I lack something: Dhawan on not being considered for T20Is
360.article_body: Talking about not being considered by selectors for T20Is, Shikhar Dhawan said, "I feel that there is a time for everything, and maybe it's not my time." He added, "Maybe I lack something that I haven't been able to do too well." He further said, "I gave my best and that's what matters...I am in a very good space."

361.title: Manika Batra's CWG 2022 campaign ends after loss in women's doubles
361.article_body: Indian duo of Manika Batra and Diya Chitale lost in quarter-final of the women's doubles table tennis event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Saturday. Charlotte Carey and Anna Hursey of Wales defeated the Indian team 11-7, 11-6, 11-13, 12-10. With this, Manika's campaign has ended at the ongoing Commonwealth Games. Notably, Manika won four medals in the 2018 edition.

362.title: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya bags India's 10th gold medal at CWG 2022
362.article_body: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya won the men's freestyle 57 kg event on Saturday to bag India's 10th gold medal at Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. The 24-year-old, who had won a silver medal at Tokyo Olympics last year, defeated Nigeria's Ebikewenimo Welson in the final to win his first CWG medal. Out of India's 10 gold medals, four have come from wrestling.

363.title: NMC invites persecuted minorities from Pak to practise medicine in India
363.article_body: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has invited applications from persecuted minorities from Pakistan, who escaped from the country and entered India on or before December 31, 2014, to practise medicine here. The NMC has invited applications from such people who have obtained Indian citizenship for the grant of permanent registration to practise modern medicine or allopathy.

364.title: Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as VP: TN CM
364.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the Vice President of India. "Hope the ideals enshrined in our constitution will be upheld during your tenure besides strengthening the democratic debates in the Upper House," he said. The voting for the Vice Presidential polls was held today.

365.title: Man gets 10 years in prison for minor's rape in Maharashtra's Latur
365.article_body: A special Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act court in Maharashtra's Latur awarded a 10-year prison sentence to a 50-year-old man for the rape of a minor girl in 2017. The girl was raped by Amol alias Ratnakar Baburao Prayag on January 30, 2017 when she went to the latter's house along with his daughter to play.

366.title: Mob attacks man with swords, hockey sticks for supporting Nupur Sharma in Maha
366.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly attacked by around 14 people carrying swords, sickle, hockey sticks etc in Maharashtra after he showed support for suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police said. Pratik alias Sunny Rajendra Pawar sustained serious injuries on his head and other body parts in the attack. Four people have been detained in connection to the August 4 incident.

367.title: Her husband wanted a son, dowry: Sister of Indian-origin woman who died by suicide in US
367.article_body: The sister of Mandeep Kaur, the Indian-origin woman who died by suicide after eight years of domestic abuse, said her husband Ranjotveer Sandhu started 'torturing' Mandeep as soon as they moved to New York. "He wanted a son and ₹50 lakh dowry," said Kuldeep Kaur. Mandeep's father alleged Sandhu's parents didn't intervene even after they were told about the abuse.

368.title: Congrats to Dhankhar, thank you Alva for representing Opp'n: Rahul
368.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the Vice-President after the latter won the polls by a margin of 346 votes on Saturday. "Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the 14th Vice-President of India...Thank you to Margaret Alva for representing the spirit of the joint Opposition with grace and dignity," Rahul tweeted.

369.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar will be an outstanding Vice President: Piyush Goyal
369.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on winning the Vice Presidential elections. "He'll be a wonderful Rajya Sabha Chairman [and] an outstanding Vice President," Goyal said. "The nation is blessed to have the son of a farmer and an eminent jurist as VP of India. We're fortunate we'll have a chance to work with him," he added.

370.title: At least 67 injured after explosion at Cuban fuel storage facility
370.article_body: Fire from the oil tank that was hit by lightning on Friday caused another fuel storage tank to explode near Cuba's supertanker port in Matanzas on Saturday morning. At least 67 people were injured in the blast on Saturday, Cuban state media reported. Notably, this comes at a time when Cuba is already facing daily blackouts and fuel shortages.

371.title: Pooja Gehlot becomes 7th Indian wrestler to win a medal at CWG 2022
371.article_body: India's 25-year-old wrestler Pooja Gehlot has become the seventh Indian wrestler to win a medal at the CWG 2022. Gehlot won a bronze medal in the women's freestyle 50 kg after beating Scotland's Christelle Lemofack Letchidjio 12-2. Overall, India have won 31 medals at CWG 2022 so far.

372.title: Alva congratulates Dhankhar, says 'some Opp'n parties supported BJP'
372.article_body: After Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as the Vice-President of India, Opposition candidate Margaret Alva congratulated him and thanked the MPs who voted for her. Alva wrote on Twitter, "This election was an opportunity for the Opposition to work together...Unfortunately, some Opposition parties chose to directly or indirectly support the BJP...in an attempt to derail the idea of a united Opposition."

373.title: Anil shares pic from 1984 film Mashaal, asks fans to 'guess the actors'
373.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor took to Instagram on Saturday to share a throwback picture from his 1984 film 'Mashaal'. "What rolling into the weekend looks like...I love this pic...Guess the names of the other actors," he wrote alongside the picture. Sanjay Kapoor commented on the post, "Gulshan Grover, Madan Jain, Raj Hans." "It's not Raj Hans," Anil replied.

374.title: Indian shuttler Aakarshi loses in singles semis, crashes out of CWG 2022
374.article_body: India's badminton player Aakarshi Kashyap crashed out of the Commonwealth Games 2022 after losing in quarter-final of the women's singles event in Birmingham on Saturday. The 20-year-old lost 10-21, 7-21 to Scotland's Kirsty Gilmour, a silver and bronze medallist in the 2014 and 2018 editions respectively. With this, Aakarshi's debut campaign ended at the ongoing Commonwealth Games.

375.title: 70-year-old temple priest beaten to death while worshipping in UP
375.article_body: A 70-year-old priest was allegedly beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Sherkot on Saturday, police said. The deceased, Begram, was conducting rituals and worship at Manokamna Mandir around 4:30 am when some unknown assailants reportedly attacked him. After his wife came out hearing his screams, the attackers fled the spot. He was rushed to the hospital but declared brought dead.

376.title: China shouldn't hold global issues hostage: US State Secretary
376.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Saturday said China should not hold hostage discussions on important global issues, such as climate change. US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan recently, triggering a reaction from China which claims Taiwan as its own territory. In retaliation, Beijing cut contacts with Washington on vital issues of military importance and climate cooperation.

377.title: Iran calls for 'realistic' US response to revive nuclear deal
377.article_body: Iran on Saturday called on the US to come up with a "realistic" response to Tehran's proposals for reviving the 2015 nuclear deal, state media reported. This came as Tehran and Washington continued indirect talks for the third day in Vienna to salvage the pact. Under the deal, Iran agreed to limit its nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief.

378.title: Nation will benefit from Dhankhar's experience of public life: Prez
378.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Saturday tweeted, "Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected the Vice President of India." "The nation will benefit from your long and rich experience of public life. My best wishes for a productive and successful tenure," she said. Notably, Dhankar won by 346 votes as he received 528 of the total 725 votes that were cast.

379.title: Unknown illness killed 61 in Chhattisgarh village in 3 yrs, claim locals
379.article_body: Residents of a remote village in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district claimed 61 people died there in three years due to an unknown illness that causes swollen hands and legs. Preliminary results of water sample examination found high fluoride and iron content in it. "As of now, we cannot say...the deaths were caused due to heavy metal content," an official said.

380.title: Cannot avoid it: Akshay on Raksha Bandhan's clash with Laal Singh Chaddha
380.article_body: Akshay Kumar has said box office clashes between films will happen because of COVID-19. "There are a lot of films that are...completed but...were not able to come out," said Akshay, whose 'Raksha Bandhan' will release on August 11, the same day as Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Now you cannot avoid it...My hope is that both...movies do well," he added.

381.title: BJP uses 'its only weapon Ram' to divert people's attention: Adhir Chowdhury
381.article_body: After Union Minister Amit Shah said Congress insulted the 'Ram bhakts' by protesting in black clothes on Ayodhya Day, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury accused BJP of "resorting to their only weapon Ram" to "divert" the attention of the people from real issue. "It is our...responsibility to raise...issues of...people...But in the name of Amrit Kaal...government has been deceiving...people," he said.

382.title: Kohli, Hassan facing same problem; too much mental pressure: Hafeez
382.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Mohammad Hafeez said that Hassan Ali and Virat Kohli are facing the "same problem". "Kohli is one of the best players of the past 10 years...He needed a break because he had too much mental pressure," Hafeez said. He added, "The management was unfair to [Hassan]...he was played in matches where he could've been rested."

383.title: Election of 'Kisan Putra' Dhankhar as VP is a matter of joy: Shah
383.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar after he was elected as India's Vice-President (VP) on Saturday. Shah tweeted that the election of "Kisan Putra" Dhankhar as the VP is a matter of joy for India. "I'm sure that as Vice President and Chairman of Rajya Sabha [he'll] prove to be an ideal guardian of the Constitution," Shah added.

384.title: Gave financial aid to kin of 789 farmers who died during protest: Mann
384.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday said that his government has completed the process of providing financial assistance to families of 789 farmers who lost their lives during the agitation against the Centre's farm laws. Each family has been given ₹5 lakh. The farmers had died due to various reasons, including harsh winter, road accidents and cardiac arrest.

385.title: Dipika-Saurav lose in mixed doubles squash semis, to play for bronze at CWG
385.article_body: Dipika Pallikal and Saurav Ghosal lost in semi-final of the mixed doubles squash event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Saturday. The Indian duo lost to Joelle King and Paul Coll of New Zealand 7-11, 4-11. Dipika and Saurav will play in the bronze medal match on Sunday. Notably, Ghosal won bronze medal in men's singles on Wednesday.

386.title: Dalai Lama honoured with Ladakh's highest civilian award
386.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama was honoured with Ladakh's highest civilian honour 'dPal rNgam Duston' award for his contribution to humanity on Friday. The 87-year-old was conferred the award by Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council (LAHDC) in Leh on the occasion of Union Territory Declaration Day. LAHDC chief Tashi Gyalson appealed for the conferment of Bharat Ratna on Dalai Lama.

387.title: CISF jawan opens fire at India's largest museum in Kolkata, 1 killed & many hurt
387.article_body: A CISF jawan opened fire at Kolkata's Indian Museum, which is the largest and oldest museum in India, killing one person and injuring several others. Kolkata Police Commissioner said that one ASI was killed and one assistant commandant rank officer was among those injured. The accused jawan, who attacked around 6:30 pm on Saturday, has been captured.

388.title: Satyendar Jain's wife gets interim bail in money laundering case
388.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday granted interim bail to Poonam Jain, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's wife, in a money laundering case. The court directed Poonam to be released on bail on a personal bond of ₹1 lakh and noted that she wasn't arrested during investigation. Meanwhile, Satyendar, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate, also withdrew his interim bail application.

389.title: Confident Jagdeep Dhankhar will make an exceptional VP: Rajnath Singh
389.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on winning the Vice Presidential elections. "His long public life, wide experience and deep understanding of people's issues will certainly benefit the nation," Singh said in a tweet. "I am confident that he will make an exceptional VP & Rajya Sabha Chairman," he added.

390.title: Firing in India's largest museum in Kolkata, 1 killed & many injured
390.article_body: A CISF jawan opened fire at Kolkata's Indian Museum, which is the largest and oldest museum in India, killing one person and injuring several others. Kolkata Police Commissioner said that one ASI was killed and one assistant commandant rank officer was among those injured. The accused jawan, who attacked around 6:30 pm on Saturday, has been captured.

391.title: India announce their playing XI for 4th T20I against West Indies, make 3 changes
391.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the fourth T20I in Florida. India have made three changes to their playing XI, with Ravi Bishnoi, Axar Patel and Sanju Samson replacing Ravichandran Ashwin, Hardik Pandya and Shreyas Iyer. India lead the five-match series 2-1.

392.title: Israel and Palestinian militants exchange fire for 2nd day
392.article_body: Israeli airstrikes on the Gaza Strip and rocket attacks by Palestinian militants on Israel continued for the second day on Saturday. The latest exchange of fire started on Friday after Israel killed an Islamic Jihad commander in an airstrike on a high-rise building in the Palestinian territory. The militants fired at least 160 rockets across the border.

393.title: 20-year-old boxer Jaismine wins India's 30th medal at CWG 2022, clinches bronze
393.article_body: India's 20-year-old boxer Jaismine settled with a bronze medal in the women's over 57kg-60kg (lightweight) category at CWG 2022 after losing the semi-final to England's Gemma Paige Richardson. With Jaismine's bronze medal, India's medal tally at CWG 2022 has reached 30. Earlier, boxers Nitu Ghanghas, Amit Panghal and Nikhat Zareen reached the finals of their respective categories.

394.title: Supreme Court to look into changing abortion law to include unmarried women
394.article_body: The Supreme Court said it will interpret the Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act and the related rules to potentially allow unmarried women to terminate pregnancies up to 24 weeks. Asking the Centre to file a note by the next hearing on August 10, SC asked why unmarried women should be barred from ending pregnancies if married women are allowed.

395.title: Zerodha Founder gets query asking 'How to become a Co-founder at Zerodha?', shares pic
395.article_body: Nithin Kamath, the Founder and CEO of Zerodha, shared the screenshot of a query by a person. "Hi Zerodha, how to become a Co-founder at Zerodha?" the person asked. Sharing the screenshot, Kamath wrote, "The queries we get." After another Twitter user asked, "What's the answer?", Zerodha's Twitter handle responded, "Error processing request."

396.title: Players get mentally tired if they play back-to-back: Dhawan
396.article_body: Amid the ongoing debate on the decision to rest some of the senior Indian players from a few series, India batter Shikhar Dhawan said that players get mentally tired if they continue to play "back-to-back". "If you see there is rotation in international cricket so that players get rest. If a player travels everywhere, he will get tired," Dhawan said.

397.title: Bangladesh hikes fuel prices by record 50% amid rising inflation
397.article_body: Bangladesh on Friday raised fuel prices by around 50%, the highest price hike in the country's history, amid rising inflation. The fuel price increase was inevitable given global market conditions, the government said. "The new prices will not seem tolerable to everyone. But we had no other choice," Nasrul Hamid, the State Minister for Power, Energy and Mineral Resources, said.

398.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar elected 14th Vice-President of India
398.article_body: NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar has been elected as the 14th Vice-President of India after defeating Opposition's candidate Margaret Alva. Dhankhar, who has served as Governor of West Bengal in the past, is a lawyer by training and belongs to Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu. The term of office of M Venkaiah Naidu, Vice-President of India, is ending on August 10.

399.title: 2 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment over Dhanbad judge's murder
399.article_body: A special Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court in Jharkhand's Dhanbad on Saturday sentenced two convicts, including an autorickshaw driver, to rigorous life imprisonment till death in a case related to Additional Sessions Judge Uttam Anand's murder. The court had in July found the two guilty in the case, a year after Anand was mowed down during a morning jog.

400.title: BCCI ethics officer asks Nita Ambani to respond to conflict of interest allegations
400.article_body: BCCI ethics officer Vineet Saran has asked MI owner Nita Ambani to respond to conflict of interest allegations against her. Nita was served a notice after Saran received a complaint from MPCA member Sanjeev Gupta. Gupta alleged Nita has conflict of interest as she's also a director at Reliance Industries, which recently bought IPL digital rights through subsidiary Viacom 18.
